result.execSummary:
All charges against Andres Lopez-Ruiz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andres Lopez-Ruiz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Andres Lopez-Ruiz in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Adam Galaviz in court for Andres Lopez-Ruiz.  Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Sarah St. John previously sworn. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. #1 confirmed for trial. Defednat will need an interpreter; Victim needs an interpreter and witness needs interpreter. If case resolves and parties do not need the interpreters, the parties are to contact Clerk of Courts by 8/31/2022 @ Noon. State is prepared for trial. Defense is prepared for trial. No agreements are reached; Defendant rejects offer. State is in compliance with victim rights. Jury Instructions to be filed by 9/2/22 @ Noon. Minutes filed.

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Arteaga

2:38pm Court in session

Defendant Andres Lopez-Ruiz appeared in court, in custody with sworn interpreter Saul Arteaga and Attorney Obi Uzowulu for attorney Leah Selmek. DDA Sempf appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Uzowulu is not aware of whether or not Atty Selmek spoke to Deft regarding his preliminary hearing. 
Deft states she has not. 
Deft wishes to proceed with hearing today. 

State makes record as to typographic error in the complaint, in paragraph 2, victim, M.A.A. dob should be 12/4/1993
No objection by Defense to that correction. Court grants amendment by the State. 

State calls Detective Troy Pagenkopf, duly sworn & testifies on direct by DDA Sempf
Detective Pagenkopf identifies the Deft by where he's located & what he's wearing. No objection by Atty Uzowulu. 
Record to reflect identification. 

Cross-Exam by Atty Uzowulu
State objects as to discovery. Atty Uzowulu strikes question. 
State objects as to relevance. Response by Atty Uzowulu. State is still objecting to the question.
Court agrees & sustains objection. 
State objects, calls for speculation. Response by Atty Uzowulu. Further argument by the State. 
Atty Uzowulu strikes the question. 

No re-direct. Detective excused. 

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed & that the Deft likely committed it & binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 

State has information & is prepared to proceed with arraignment. 
Atty Selmek now appears in court with Deft.
Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Court orders no contact under 940.47, defendant is not to contact or intimidate victims or witnesses. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH M.A.A. (dob 12-4-1993) OR J.A.N. (dob 5-17-1993) OR RESIDENCES.Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
